posts.post_content:
"If the Tetravus is destroyed when the Tetravites are off the card, they are not destroyed, they are just orphaned."
  
That is just so depressing.
  
Poor Tetravites never knew their mommy that well.
  
Maybe my opponent will refuse to destroy Tetravus because of the emotional scars that would be left.

posts.post_content:
@LouisianaxLimey  
  
The way it's ruled on says you can put the abilities on the stack in any order you want, but not multiple times, which means, the best you can do per-turn is remove all the counters and sacrifice them all to quadruple the counters on it. Still not bad, but definitely not infinite.

Posted By: Buridan (3/16/2010 3:46:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"This card now has two upkeep-triggered abilities. Its controller chooses the order they are put on the stack, and thus the order in which they resolve each upkeep."  
  
So you basically put  
  
>Remove counters from this permanent and make them into 1/1s  
  
and then  
  
>Transform 1/1 counters into +1/+1 counters for Tetravus  
  
Onto the stack. You cannot duplicate and use the ability multiple times, is basically what the ruling is saying. One usage per upkeep.
posts.html:
"This card now has two upkeep-triggered abilities. Its controller chooses the order they are put on the stack, and thus the order in which they resolve each upkeep."

and then

>Transform 1/1 counters into +1/+1 counters for Tetravus

Onto the stack. You cannot duplicate and use the ability multiple times, is basically what the ruling is saying. One usage per upkeep.

posts.post_content:
Infinite combo with [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season) since you can just infinitely remove and put them back on doubling each time.  
  
Still, paved the way for [Pentavus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pentavus) and has a nice concept, a slid 4/5, despite hoe broken it is.
